How to run back to the past [mn131:11.4]: Muster delight there, thinking: ‘I had such form in the past.’
Muster delight there, thinking: ‘I had such feeling … perception … choice … consciousness in the past.’
How to not run back to the past [mn131:1: Don’t muster delight there, thinking: ‘I had such form in the past.’
Don’t muster delight there, thinking: ‘I had such feeling … perception … choice … consciousness in the past.’
How to hope for the future [mn131:11.4]: Muster delight there, thinking: ‘May I have such form in the future.’
Muster delight there, thinking: ‘May I have such feeling … perception … choice … consciousness in the future.’
How to not hope for the future [mn131:11: Don’t muster delight there, thinking: ‘May I have such form in the future.’
Don’t muster delight there, thinking: ‘May I have such feeling … perception … choice … consciousness in the future.’
How to falter amid presently arisen phen: Regard form as self, self as having form, form in self, or self in form.
Regard feeling … perception … choices … consciousness as self, self as having consciousness, consciousness in self, or self in consciousness.
How to not falter amid presently arisen: Don’t regard form as self, self as having form, form in self, or self in form.
Don’t regard feeling … perception … choices … consciousness as self, self as having consciousness, consciousness in self, or self in consciousness.
